intro: Grisebachianthus plucheoides, commonly known as the silverleaf daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its silvery-gray foliage and daisy-like yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and thrives in full sun. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its compact growth habit and long-lasting blooms. Grisebachianthus plucheoides is also valued for its drought tolerance and ability to attract pollinators.
